episode_title: 817 - The One With The Tea Leaves

content.description: The Hallway, Rachel walks up the stairs and knocks on Joey’s door.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey? Are you in there?
[Cut to inside Monica and Chandler’s, Monica, Chandler and Joey are eating breakfast.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh God! That’s Rachel!
content.parenthetical: hearing Rachel and jumping up with his plate

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, you have to talk to her!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no, I can’t! I can’t! Not after the other night, it’s just it’s…too weird, okay? Don’t tell her I’m here! (Turns to run to the bathroom and his bagel falls off the plate onto the floor.) Don’t eat that! (Runs to the bathroom as Rachel enters.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is Joey here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t see him. (To Monica) Do you see him?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t see him. Hey! Maybe he’s in the sugar bowl! (Opens the sugar bowl) Joey? Nope! (Closes the sugar bowl and they both laugh.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, at least you make each other laugh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I haven’t seen him since that night that he told me how he y’know… I don’t know, I think he’s avoiding me. Why is that bagel on the floor?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We were playing a game.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ew, was Chandler naked? Sort of like a, like a ring toss kind of situation?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?! No! No!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right. Well listen, if you see Joey will you just tell him uh…tell him I miss him. (Exits and Joey enters.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, did you hear that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, a naked bagel game? (Picks up his dropped bagel.) (To Chandler) Dude, I don’t know. That’s a pretty small hole.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, you gotta talk to her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t! Y’know? You guys don’t know what it’s like to put yourself out there like that and just get shot down.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know what that’s like?! Up until I was 25 I thought the only response to, “I love you,” was, “Oh crap!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello? No rejection? I got shot down at fat camp! Boy, kids are mean when they’re hungry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right so, so what do I do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is Rachel. I mean, what are you gonna do, never going to talk to her again? I mean I know it’s weird, it’s awkward, but you gotta at least try.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Okay. (Goes to take a bite out of the previously mentioned bagel.) Whoa! (Stops.) I almost forgot this was on your…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We didn’t play it!!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is holding a book as she, Rachel, and Monica drink some tea as Chandler looks on.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, so when you’re done with your tea I’ll look at your leaves and tell you your fortune.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I didn’t know you read tea leaves.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, I’ve done it for years. I actually stopped because I was so accurate. Y’know, and-and y’know, one of the great joys of life is it’s-it’s wondrous unpredictability. Y’know? And also tea tends to give me the trots.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’m done. Read mine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Looks at the leaves.) Ooh, I see a ladder. (Checks the book) Which can mean either a promotion or a violent death.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I-I’m the head chef. I-I can’t get promoted.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-hmm. Uh-hmm, who’s next?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I’m done. Do mine.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Reads the leaves) Umm, oh! Okay, I see a circle.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! (Checking the book) Which can either mean you’re having a baby or you’re gonna make a scientific discovery!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I have been spending a lot of time in the lab.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What does yours say Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm… Wow, all right. (Checks the book.) Wow! Yay! Ooh, I’m gonna meet a guy! And really soon! And he’s gonna be the man of my dreams. Probably not the guy I had a dream about last night. (Points at Chandler.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Has anyone seen my shirt? It’s a button down, like a, like a faded salmon?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You mean your pink shirt?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Faded salmon color.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I-I haven’t seen your pink shirt.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great! Great. Then I must’ve left it at Mona’s. I knew it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m sure you get another one at Ann Taylor’s .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s my favorite shirt! Okay? I love that shirt!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well just ask Mona to give it back!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know. I mean I-I guess I could. It’s just that we didn’t really end things such good terms. And if I go over there I’d be ignoring the one thing she asked me to do when we broke up, jump up my own ass and die. (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh wait a second you guys…for the last couple weeks I’ve been that guy everywhere I go. We take the same bus. We go to the same bookstore, the same dry cleaners; maybe he’s the tea guy. (He gets up to leave, and smiles at Phoebe.)
content.parenthetical: noticing a guy sitting by the green post looking at her

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebe, did you see that?! He totally checked you out! He is so cute! (Looking at his tea.) Mine has a picture of The Village People , what does that mean?
(Joey enters.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.
(He slowly walks to the other side of the couch and sits down at the table, an awkward silence follows.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi.
(More awkward silence.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Tea gives Phoebe the trots.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is cooking as Rachel paces nervously.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So I thought Joey and I would be okay once we hung out, but it’s not even like we know how to be with each other anymore.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know it’s tough now, but things will get better.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How do you know that? What if it just gets worse and worse and worse, to the point where we can’t even be in the same room with each other?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not great at the advice, can I interest you in a sarcastic comment? Some cheese?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, what is the Bruce Springsteen CD in the Kat Stevens case?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let’s just say if I can’t find the right CD case I just put it in the nearest one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, where is the Kat Stevens CD?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: In the James Taylor case.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where is the James Taylor CD?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey, I’m gonna save you some time, 200 CDs, not one of them in the right case.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. No need to panic. Deep breathes everyone. Okay umm uh, we’re just gonna have to spend some time and put the CDs in the right cases.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, if we’re gonna do that we should come up with some kind of order. Y’know alphabetically or by genre?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hmm, I don’t know. We really have to talk this through.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!! You guys have such problems!! I feel so terrible for you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I-I’m sorry. You and Joey, your both focusing on this uncomfortable thing, what you need to do is to change the subject. Next time you see him try to get him talking about something else.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah. That makes sense.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, like I don’t know, maybe you have a work problem that you need his advice on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, I can do that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Good. (To Chandler) Uh honey, the Miami Vice soundtrack? Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They were just giving those away at the store (off Monica’s look) in exchange for money.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh I really don’t know what to tell you Rach, I really don’t. I mean, maybe Joey can help you out with your, with your big work problem.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah Joey she’s…Rachel’s got this really big work problem, and it is a head scratcher. Wow! (To Chandler) Y’know what, if we’re gonna make dinner we’re gonna have to leave. Yeah. (She and Chandler exit.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So you uh, have a…big work problem?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah it’s umm… Yeah it’s uh… It-it’s y’know—It’s nothing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh. Okay. (Awkward silence.) So uh, I think I’m gonna take off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah—No wait! Joey no wait it is. It’s something. It’s-it’s umm…it’s my boss.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, and umm my baby.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: My boss wants to buy my baby!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! Oh my-oh my God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know I told you, it’s a really big problem.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What he wants to buy your baby?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Can you believe that?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s crazy!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s what I told him!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, how did this even happen?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well I’ll tell ya! (Pause) See uh my-my boss and his wife—They-they can’t have children. So umm, and that—we were at the Christmas party, and he got drunk, and he said to me, “Rachel, I want to buy your baby.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man! When you said it was a problem about your boss and the baby I figured it was something about maternity leave.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! Yeah! (Pause) Yeah that-that would’ve been a much simpler problem.

content.description: A newsstand, Phoebe is looking at a magazine as the guy from before walks by and picks up a newspaper.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh hello.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Oh, it’s you. I see you everywhere. I’m Jim, Jim Nelson.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh Jim, Jim Nelson I’m Phoebe, Phoebe Buffay. We certainly have been seeing a lot of each other lately.

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: We have. Maybe we’ll be seeing each other at dinner tomorrow night, say around 8 o’clock?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, maybe we will. (Starts to walk away.) Oh! (She turns around and the exchange information.)

content.description: Outside Mona’s Apartment, Ross is knocking on the door.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mona? (There’s no answer, so he starts to leave but remembers where her extra key is. He reaches atop a hall light just outside her door and grabs the key. He looks at in triumph as the pain from it being hot moves along his nervous system to his brain, and when it arrives his brain orders his hand to drop the hot key and his mouth to squeal in pain. After dropping the key he pulls his shirtsleeve over his hand and uses the key to open the door and enter Mona’s apartment.) Okay, if I were a salmon shirt, where would I be? (He hears a key in the door and as it opens he dives behind the couch.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: I am so sorry I spilled wine all over your shirt.

content.speaker: Mona’s Date
content.text: Oh, it’s okay.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: No, it’s still wet. Y’know what? Let me get it out before it sets. Ooh, I have something you can wear. Here. (Hands him Ross’s shirt.)

content.speaker: Mona’s Date
content.text: Oh umm, I-I don’t know if I want to wear a woman’s shirt.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: No-no that’s a man’s shirt.

content.speaker: Mona’s Date
content.text: It’s awfully pink. (Ross mouths, “It’s salmon!”)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica and Chandler are sorting their CDs.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God, honey we are so meant to be together. We both have copies of the Annie soundtrack.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, both yours.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Great advice on that Joey thing!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah? The work problem?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh it was perfect! I mean it really felt like he was my friend again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What problem did you tell him you had?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh that’s not important. The point is, I really—I think everything’s gonna be okay.

content.description: Mr. Zelner’s Office, he’s in a meeting as Joey bursts in.

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: May I help you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you think you can just buy my friends baby?!

content.description: A restaurant, Phoebe and Jim are on their date.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Isn’t it funny how we kept running into each other? It’s as if someone really wants us to be together.

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: Someone does. Me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, witty banter. Well done.

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: So, tell me a little bit about yourself.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh okay, well I’m a masseuse, and I used to work at this place…

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: Do you like to party?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I-I like, I like parties.

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: You’re wild, aren’t ya?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah I guess, a little.

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: It ain’t no thing, I’m wild too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So! Umm, anyway I-I lived in New York, someone wildly I guess, for umm—Well since I was fourteen.

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: I’m sorry. I’m staring. It’s just that you have the most beautiful eyes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh stop it.

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: And your breasts! Hmm!!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Umm look, you’re coming on a little strong. But I’m going to give you the benefit of the doubt, because it seems the universe really wants to be together. So, why don’t we just start over okay? And you can just tell me about yourself.

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: I write erotic novels, for children.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: They’re wildly unpopular.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: Oh also, you might be interested to know that I have a Ph.D.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! You do?

content.speaker: Jim
content.text: Yeah, (looks at his crotch) a Pretty Huge…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. (Gets up and walks out.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica, Chandler, and now Rachel are organizing CDs.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The sun’ll come out…tomorrow! Bet …your bottom dollar that tomorrow … (The girls start laughing, and in a deep voice) …there’ll be sun .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Oh Joey, honey listen, thank you for talking to my yesterday about that thing with my boss. That really meant a lot.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not a problem. Oh, and just so you know, that guy’s not going to be bothering you about that baby thing anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let’s just say I took care of it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa, let’s say more!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t worry! Don’t worry. I just told him, very nicely, “You don’t go buying people’s babies, so back off!!”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler and Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! No, no-no-no Joey he doesn’t want to buy my baby! I made that up!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! Why?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So that we would have something to talk about! So it wouldn’t be awkward!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And you couldn’t think of anything else?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You said your boss wants to buy your baby?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t believe that you yelled at my boss! I’m-I’m gonna lose my job! What am I going to do?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You can always sell your baby.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Joey, I can’t believe you brought my boss into this! I’m gonna get fired!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You lied to me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, she told me too! (Points to Monica and Joey glares at her.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler has two copies of Annie !

content.description: Mona’s Apartment, she and her date are making out as Ross flips through a magazine while lying behind the couch and sees something that he likes. Meanwhile, Mona’s date takes off Ross’s shirt and Mona throws it on the floor. While they start making out again, Ross tries to pull the rug the shirt is on over to him, but while he does that he moves the coffee table and it bumps into the couch.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh my God! Ross!!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello!!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Ross, what are you doing?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not touching myself if that makes anyone less uncomfortable.

content.description: Mr. Zelner’s Office, Rachel is knocking on the door.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Morning. You wanted to see me?

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Please, come in. Have a seat. (She does so.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay look Mr. Zelner…

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: Oh I think it’s best that I speak first.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. (Motions for him to continue.)

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: I’ve asked Lee from human resources to be here as a witness to our conversation.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God.

content.speaker: Mr. Zelner
content.text: If I in any way implied that I wanted to buy your baby…I am sorry. Okay? Last week when I asked you when your due date was uh, I certainly did not mean that I felt that I was due your baby. Yeah, I want to be very clear that I understand that its your baby, and it is not mine to purchase.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, as long as we are clear about that. (Exits smugly.)

content.description: A Street, Phoebe and Monica are walking down it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh there it is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s not your regular dry cleaners.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, but that creep that I went on that date with goes to there so I have to find a new one. I also have to find a new video store, a new bank, a new adult bookstore, a new grocery store…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: A new grocery store. The universe said I was going to meet a nice guy and that’s what they gave me? (Looks up) When I get up there I’m going to kick some ass.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t worry Phoebe, you’re gonna meet someone. If I can meet a great guy, so can you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, we both can. And we both will.
(They enter the dry cleaners.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you didn’t have to come in with me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you kidding? This is where they get out stains! Okay? This is like Disneyland for me. I’m-I’m gonna be over here watching the dance of the clean shirts. (She points to and walks over to the electric clothes rack they have.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.
(A guy enters that looks suspiciously like Alec Baldwin from The Hunt for Red October, Pearl Harbor, and Beetlejuice.)

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Oh, excuse me! I think you dropped s…(looks at Phoebe.) Wow!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: I’m sorry, it’s just that you’re so incredibly beautiful.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah well, I’m sorry about that too, but what are you going to do?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: I hope you don’t think I’m crazy but I feel like I was meant to pick this up, do you believe in that kind of thing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: A little. (She turns around and looks up.) (To the universe) Now you’re talking.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Would you like to go out and have a cup of coffee?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I-I’d love to. Let me just tell my friend.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooh, an ink stain! Hey, can I watch how you get this out?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She must’ve left.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is watching Joey pace nervously as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So? What-what-what happened?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s all gonna be okay. They’re just so happy that I’m not suing them that they gave me one extra month paid maternity leave. So long as I understand that the money should not construed as a down payment on this or any other child I should bear.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow, Ralph Lauren is really going out of there way to show they’re not in the baby buying business.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler, can you give us a minute?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh I’m sorry, you’re kicking me out of my own living room?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll be in there. (Goes into the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, I’m really sorry that I lied to you. I was just trying to make things…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know. I know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It kinda worked. I mean y’know, I don’t know about you buy I haven’t thought about our thing since all this.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey you’re right. Yeah, it’s kinda been like us again a little bit.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah I know! I miss that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too. I mean I…haven’t thought at all about how I put myself out there and said all that stuff and how you didn’t feel the same way about me and-and how it was really awkward.
(Awkward silence.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: My gynecologist tried to kill me.

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s, Ross is ordering something over the phone from a catalog.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Item J437-A, color: winterberry. (There’s a knock on the door as he hangs up the phone. He answers it to Mona.) Hi umm, listen come here, come in. (She does so.) I’m so-so sorry about yesterday. I-I’m really sorry. It’s just that I… (He picks up the pink shirt.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Listen Ross, you don’t have to apologize. I understand why you were there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You do?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Yeah, you still have feelings for me. And-and to be honest, I-I still have feelings for you. And I wish that we can work it out Ross, but we can’t. It’s too complicated with you and Rachel and the baby, I-I just… It just wasn’t meant to be.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh God you’re right.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Ross, we…we have to be strong. Okay, I-I’m gonna go. (She picks up the shirt Ross has just set down.) Can I? To remember you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. (Takes the shirt back.)
